item.title: write4 | ROPEmporium [4]
item.description: Functions themselves are in an external library we should call it from there. Imported files proves the command rabin2 -i <binary>

item.title: callme | ROPEmporium [3]
item.description: Ok we have three functions, and we should call them with arguments, which are given, there are 0xdeadbeef,¬†0xcafebabe,¬†0xd00df00d . Functions itself are in external library we should call them one by one. Buffer overflow offset is the same, and checksec

item.title: split | ROPEmporium [2]
item.description: In this challenge, we should run system() function with argument /bin/cat flag.txt

item.title: ret2win | ROPEmporium [1]
item.description: One common introductory ROP challenge is known as ret2win. The goal is to call a specific function in the program called ret2win, which prints a success message and reveal a flag.txt

item.title: About
item.description:
Hi, I’m Ravshan! I’m a cybersecurity researcher with a passion for digging deep into anything that involves assembly üòä. I love uncovering how things work at the most fundamental levels, but it is hard to do. When I’m not diving into cybersecurity, you can find me cycling, exploring new routes and staying active. üö¥‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

This blog marks the beginning of my journey, and while I’ll keep adding more details in the future, for now, this is a good start. Thanks for stopping by, and I hope you find something useful here!
